result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
per commissioner, request to reschedule status conference approved. jr.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Brittany GT.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile unless supervised by a responsible adult. 
- Defendant shall not leave the United States without prior approval of the Court. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

8:53 AM Defendant Gustavo Lopez Olayo in court.  Attorney Robert Thomas Ruth in court for Gustavo Lopez Olayo.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Fayme FIlipiak interpreted. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
